structural_analysis.context_justification: The document begins with the explicit header 'प्रथमा वल्ली' (1) and the first parsed unit (Mantra) is numbered 1. The standard structure is Valli -> Mantra.
structural_analysis.filename_justification: Combines grantha ID, commentary author slug (rangaramanuja), and zero-padded start ID (01-01) for unique, sortable naming.

proposed_strategy.name: Single Section Chunking
proposed_strategy.description: The entire provided document contains only the First Valli of the Katha Upanishad with commentary. Since the total character count (28,328) is far below the safety limit, the entire Valli is processed as a single chunk.

execution_plan.description: Katha Upanishad, Prathama Valli (all Mantras 1-30) and commentary.

parsing_instructions.justification: Mantra is the lowest and most numerous structural unit within the Valli, serving as the basis for detailed commentary segmentation.
parsing_instructions.numbering_capture_strategy: Extract the Devanagari numeral appearing at the end of the Mantra text line, enclosed by double pipe delimiters (।। X ।।).

start_pattern.description: Matches the numbering structure at the end of the Mantra text, which acts as the delimiter for the start of the next unit.

end_pattern.description: The end of a Mantra is marked by the start of the subsequent Mantra, or by the final structural colophon for the entire Valli.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: Treat all text from 'श्रीः' up to the start of the first Mantra text ('उशन् ह वै वाजश्रवसः') as 'Prefatory Material' (Pithika/Śānti Pāṭha).
